cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 73 (Monday, April 29, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. D'ESPOSITO:H.R. 8146.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the United States ConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:To require a report by the Attorney General on the impactthe border crisis is having on law enforcement at theFederal, State, local, and Tribal level.[Page H2700]

item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8369) to provide for the expeditious delivery of defense articles and defense services for Israel and other matters; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7530) to limit youth offender status in the District of Columbia to individuals 18 years of age or younger, to direct the Attorney General of the District of Columbia to establish and operate a publicly accessible website containing updated statistics on juvenile crime in the District of Columbia, to amend the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to prohibit the Council of the District of Columbia from enacting changes to existing criminal liability sentences, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7343) to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide for the detention of certain aliens who commit assault against law enforcement officers; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8146) to require a report by the Attorney General on the impact the border crisis is having on law enforcement at the Federal, State, local, and Tribal level; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7581) to require the Attorney General to develop reports relating to violent attacks against law enforcement officers, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 354) to amend title 18, United States Code, to improve the Law Enforcement Officer Safety Act and provisions relating to the carrying of concealed weapons by law enforcement officers, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1213) a resolution regarding violence against law enforcement officers; and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1210) condemning the Biden border crisis and the tremendous burdens law enforcement officers face as a result.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 254 - 157 (Roll no. 215).
Passed/agreed to in House: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 254 - 157 (Roll no. 215).
The House adopted the amendments en gros as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 8146.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H3308-3310)
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 8146 as unfinished business.
On motion that the committee rise Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. McClintock moved that the committee rise.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1227, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes debate on the Miller (IL) amendment No. 8.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1227, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes debate on the LaLota amendment No. 7.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on the Houlahan amendment No. 6, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Houlahan demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1227, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes debate on the Houlahan amendment No. 6.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1227, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes debate on the Nunn (IA) amendment No. 5.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1227, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes debate on the Nunn (IA) amendment No. 4.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1227, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes debate on the D'Esposito amendment No. 3.
GENERAL DEBATE - The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 8146.
The Speaker designated the Honorable John H. Rutherford to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 1227 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8369, H.R. 7530, H.R. 7343, H.R. 8146, H.R. 7581, H.R. 354, H. Res. 1213 and H. Res. 1210. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8369, H.R. 7530, H.R. 7581, H.R. 354, H. Res. 1213, and H. Res. 1210 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate each. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 7343 and H.R. 8146 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate each. Rule provides for one motion to recommit each on H.R. 8369, H.R. 7530, H.R. 7343, H.R. 7581, H.R. 354, and H.R. 8146.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1227. (consideration: CR H3297-3308; text: CR H3302)

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 1227 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8369, H.R. 7530, H.R. 7343, H.R. 8146, H.R. 7581, H.R. 354, H. Res. 1213 and H. Res. 1210. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8369, H.R. 7530, H.R. 7581, H.R. 354, H. Res. 1213, and H. Res. 1210 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate each. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 7343 and H.R. 8146 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate each. Rule provides for one motion to recommit each on H.R. 8369, H.R. 7530, H.R. 7343, H.R. 7581, H.R. 354, and H.R. 8146.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 400.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 118-482.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 118-482.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 14 - 10.

item.title: H.R. 8146, Police our Border Act
item.description: As reported by the House Committee on the Judiciary on May 6, 2024

cdata.text:
Police Our Border Act

This bill requires the Department of Justice to report on the impact of the Biden Administration's border policies on law enforcement officers at the federal, state, local, and tribal levels.

Police Our Border Act

This bill requires the Department of Justice to report on the impact of the Biden Administration's border policies on law enforcement officers at the federal, state, local, and tribal levels.

Police Our Border Act

This bill requires the Department of Justice to report on the impact of the Biden Administration's border policies on law enforcement officers at the federal, state, local, and tribal levels.

item.titleType: Short Titles from RFS (Referred to Senate) bill text
item.title: Police Our Border Act

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to House
item.title: Police Our Border Act
To require a report by the Attorney General on the impact the border crisis is having on law enforcement at the Federal, State, local, and Tribal level.

amendment.description: An amendment numbered 8 printed in Part B of House Report 118-511 to add to the findings section that it is in the best interest of law enforcement officers and the communities they serve for the administration to use longstanding authorities, including under section 212(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act, to secure the southern border.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Miller (IL) amendment (A006) Agreed to by voice vote.

item.text: On agreeing to the Miller (IL) amendment (A006) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment (A006) offered by Mrs. Miller (IL). (consideration: CR H3307-3308; text: CR H3307)
House Amendment Offered
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Miller (IL) amendment (A006) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendment.description: An amendment numbered 7 printed in Part B of House Report 118-511 to require the nationality of an illegal alien to be reported on, once they have exposed a law enforcement officer to fentanyl during an encounter at the border and in the United States.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the LaLota amendment (A005) Agreed to by voice vote.

item.text: On agreeing to the LaLota amendment (A005) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment (A005) offered by Mr. LaLota. (consideration: CR H3306-3307; text: CR H3306)
House Amendment Offered
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the LaLota amendment (A005) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendment.description: An amendment numbered 6 printed in Part B of House Report 118-511 to strike Section (2) lines 17-19 and strike the word "Biden" throughout the text.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Houlahan amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 197 - 213 (Roll no. 214).

item.text: On agreeing to the Houlahan amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 197 - 213 (Roll no. 214).
Amendment (A004) offered by Ms. Houlahan. (consideration: CR H3305-3306, H3309; text: CR H3305)
House Amendment Offered
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Houlahan amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 197 - 213 (Roll no. 214).
Roll call votes on amendments in House

amendment.description: An amendment numbered 5 printed in Part B of House Report 118-511 to require the Attorney General's report to include data on how many law enforcement officers have been reassigned, and local resources reallocated, to investigate, intercept, and process as evidence fentanyl trafficked from the United States border.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Nunn (IA) amendment (A003) Agreed to by voice vote.

item.text: On agreeing to the Nunn (IA) amendment (A003) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment (A003) offered by Mr. Nunn (IA). (consideration: CR H3304-3305; text: CR H3304)
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Nunn (IA) amendment (A003) Agreed to by voice vote.
House Amendment Offered

amendment.description: An amendment numbered 4 printed in Part B of House Report 118-511 to require the Attorney General's report to include costs States had to expend on local law enforcement efforts to investigate, intercept, and process, which includes the collection, analysis, storage, and eventual destruction, fentanyl trafficked from the United States border.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Nunn (IA) amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.

item.text: On agreeing to the Nunn (IA) amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment (A002) offered by Mr. Nunn (IA). (consideration: CR H3302-3304; text: CR H3302)
House Amendment Offered
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Nunn (IA) amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.

amendment.description: An amendment numbered 3 printed in Part B of House Report 118-511 to add a provision to the required report to also include the impact that the border crisis has had on law enforcement recruitment.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the D'Esposito amendment (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
